page.title: 05 HIGHAM CHURCH
page.content: Higham has two churches,an old church and a new church.The older church is near to Shorne marshes.It holds roughly 150 people and was built by the Saxons and extended by the Normans.However,25 years ago the church stopped being used regularly.It is now only used for three services each year.However it is open all year round and is visited by many tourists.The new church is in Telegraph Hill.The church holds roughly about 200 people and is used only by the people of Higham.One of the walls of the church is made from part of the old Rochester bridge.There is a modern hall to the side of the church which is used extensively by many varied groups connected to the church.These include a youth club,womens groups and choir singers.
